page.title: 10BOUGHTON AND VILLAGE HALL
page.content: The name Boughton Monchelsea derives from the Anglo-Saxon 'Bocton', meaning 'clearing in a beech wood', and the name 'Montchensies', from the Norman family who owned the estate in the 12th century. The village hall was built in 1978, the result of a great deal of local effort, time and money. It stands on the edge of the village playing field and is used for many different activities. Various sports clubs use it: football, cricket, netball, squash and badminton. A playgroup operates on Monday and Thursday mornings, and Scouts, Cubs, Guides and Brownies also meet here. In the evenings there are Parish Council meetings, Beetle Drives and the occasional dance, play or other entertainment. The hall has shower facilities, a stage, a kitchen and a small committee room.
